thread.section_title: Travel News, Tips, and Guides - USATODAY.com
thread.title: New Norwegian Cruise Line boss is making changes
thread.title_full: New Norwegian Cruise Line boss is making changes

title: New Norwegian Cruise Line boss is making changes
text:
Among the most notable features on Norwegian Escape's top deck is Aqua Park, a family-friendly fun zone billed as the largest of its kind at sea. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Norwegian Escape's Aqua Park features Free Fall, touted as the fastest water slide at sea, and another slide that takes inner tubes designed for two -- a first for Norwegian. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Two passengers at a time can ride an inner tube down the Aqua Racer slide on the port side of the Norwegian Escape's Aqua Park (the big blue slide on the right in this picture). Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Norwegian Escape's Aqua Park is being billed as the largest water park at sea. It has five water slides in all. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Free Fall water slides on the Norwegian Escape kick off with a near vertical drop over the side of the ship. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The water slide zone atop the Norwegian Escape includes a watery play area for children called the Kid's Aqua Park. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The hub of the Norwegian Escape's top deck is its main pool area located on Deck 16. The layout differs from the main pool areas of recent Norwegian ships; it features a double-decker bar and more room for lounge chairs. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen In another new twist, the Norwegian Escape has two large outdoor screens overlooking the main pool on Deck 16. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Waves pool bar on Deck 17 overlooks the main pool. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen More lounge chairs line the sides of the ship on Deck 17. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A large portion of the read part of the Norwegian Escape's top deck is devoted to the largest ropes course at sea. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Passengers can walk 'The Plank' out over the side of the ship, eighteen decks above the sea. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Passengers suit up in harnesses before climbing on to the ropes course on Deck 18. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Nine holes of miniature golf are among the attractions at the Sports Complex at the back of the Norwegian Escape on Deck 18. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Norwegian Escape also is home to first bocce ball court at sea. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A full basketball court also is part of the sports zone at the back of the ship. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Among the outdoor venues on Norwegian Escape is the first Margaritaville at sea. It's located near the main pool. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A circular opening on the Norwegian Escape provides a visual connection -- and stairway access -- between the restaurants and nightspots of Decks 6, 7 and 8 Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Also returning on Norwegian Escape is Norwegian's signature French restaurant Le Bistro. It's located on Deck 6 in the same space as on Norwegian Getaway and Norwegian Breakaway. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Norwegian Escape boasts Norwegian Cruise Line's first craft beer-focused outpost, called the District Brew House Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The District Brew House offers 24 beers on tap as well as more than 50 in bottles. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Located on Deck 6, the Headliners Comedy Club is a lively spot in the evenings. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Headliners Comedy Club has a complete bar. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Norwegian Escape's main showroom, the Escape Theater, holds 900 passengers -- about 150 more than the main theaters on the Norwegian Breakaway and Norwegian Getaway. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Also new on the Norwegian Escape is the Supper Club, which offers dinner shows. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Supper Club has plush banquet seating. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Mixx bar. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Located on Deck 6 of the Norwegian Escape is Taste, one of three main dining rooms. It serves traditional cuisine with a contemporary flair. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A second main dining room is Savor, which offers classic dishes and a modern decor. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Another of the three main dining rooms on Norwegian Escape is the Manhattan Room, which offers live music and dancing along with meals at dinnertime. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen New on Norwegian Escape is the Skyline Bar, located adjacent to the ship's casino on Deck 7 Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Skyline Bar is located in space that is home to a disco on earlier Norwegian ships. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Norwegian Escape has a large casino spread across Deck 7. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Escape Casino is larger than the casinos on Norwegian Getaway and Norwegian Breakaway, spilling into space previously used for an Asian noodle bar. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Spreading between Decks 6 and 7, the Norwegian Escape's centrally located Atrium is wider than its sister spaces on Norwegian Getaway and Norwegian Breakaway (the entire ship is about two meters wider, allowing for a number of larger venues) Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A popular meeting point on the ship is The Bar at the Atrium, located at the bottom of the ship's three-deck-high atrium near the Guest Services desk. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The bar at O'Sheehan's. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Like Norwegian Getaway and Norwegian Breakaway, Norwegian Escape is home to a lively pub called O'Sheehan's. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen O'Sheehan's has several pool tables along with other popular bar amusements. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Skee-ball is among the attractions in a corner of the O'Sheehan's pub on Norwegian Escape. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen O'Sheehan's also is home two two bowling lanes. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Another new concept for Norwegian on the Norwegian Escape is Food Republic, a casual eatery with a mix of cuisines including sushi available from four stations. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Passengers dining at Food Republic will order through iPads located at tables. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Food Republic offers seating overlooking the ocean. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The La Cucina Italian eatery found on previous Norwegian ship returns on Norwegian Escape on Deck 8. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Also new on Norwegian Escape is Tobacco Road, a re-creation of a Miami landmark that closed in 2014. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A smoking room is located at the back of Tobacco Road. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Also new on the Norwegian Escape is The Cellars, A Michael Mondavi Family Wine Bar -- Norwegian's first wine bar at sea. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Cellars wine bar takes the place of the Ice Bar found on recent Norwegian ships. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Cellars will serve Mondavi wines by the glass in a stylish setting. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Norwegian Escape features celebrity chef's Jose Garces' first restaurant at sea, a Cuban eatery called Bayamo by Jose Garces. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Adjacent to Bayamo is the mojito-serving Sugarcane Mojito Bar. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Deck 8 also is home to second eatery by celebrity chef Jose Garces called Pincho Tapas Bar. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Like the Norwegian Getaway and Norwegian Breakaway, Norwegian Escape has a large Teppanyaki restaurant on Deck 6. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The aft portion of Deck 8 on the Norwegian Escape is home to a large duty free shopping area. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Norwegian Escape is home to the first Lacoste boutique at sea. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Norwegian Escape also offers the first Carolina Herrera boutique at sea. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen In a change from recent Norwegian ships, shopping stands have been designed into the sides of the corridor on Deck 8 instead of in the middle, improving traffic flow. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Also at the base of Escape's atrium on Deck 6 is the Atrium Cafe. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Atrium Cafe serves espresso drinks for an extra charge and an array of pastries and bake goods. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Norwegian Escape offers more than a dozen full-service restaurants, including Brazilian-style steakhouse Moderno Churrascaria. The eatery's specialty is grilled and slow-roasted meats that are carved tableside by passadors. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Adjacent to Moderno Churrascaria on Deck 8 is Cagney's Steakhouse, a Norwegian signature that is priced a la carte with entrees ranging from $16 to $25. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Just off the Norwegian Escape's main pool on Deck 16 is the casual Garden Cafe eatery. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Garden Cafe serves a wide range of cuisine from in a buffet setting. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A Garden Cafe chef lines up desserts for dinnertime. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen At the back of Deck 16 is Norwegian Escape's casual buffet eatery, the Garden Cafe Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Garden Cafe has its own bar area near the entrance from the main pool. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Chill Bar is incorporated into the first Margaritaville at sea. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Hot tubs flank both sides of Spice H20. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Located at the back of Deck 17 is Spice H2O, an adult-only outdoor retreat with lounge chairs, hot tubs and a waterfall grotto. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Located on Deck 17, Entourage is a lounge on the Norwegian Escape dedicated exclusively to teens. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Like other recent Norwegian ships, Norwegian Escape boasts an exclusive, multi-deck retreat for passengers in top suites called The Haven. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Haven's private, magrodome-covered pool area features lounge chairs in and out of the water. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Haven's magrodome-covered pool area also has two hot tubs. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Three decks high, The Haven on Norwegian Escape features two indoor lounge areas. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Haven Lounge on Deck 17 has its own bar accessible only to passengers staying in a Haven suite. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Among the more upscale accommodations on the Norwegian Escape are its 14 The Haven Spa Suites, which are part of the ship's exclusive Haven complex. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Haven Spa Suites measure 280 square feet (not including the balcony) and come with complimentary access to the Norwegian Escape's thermal spa area. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Among spa-like touches in The Haven Spa Suites is a personal hot tub-like bath built into the bedroom. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Haven Spa Suites feature a large built-in armoire near the entrance among other storage. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Armoires in The Haven Spa Suites have room for hanging clothes and come with an umbrella for passenger use. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Spa suite bathrooms are large with double-faucet sinks and walk-in showers. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Spa Suite bathrooms have a sleek, contemporary design. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Norwegian Escape passengers will find free soft serve ice cream on Deck 16 inside the Garden Cafe. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Located on Deck 16, the Norwegian Escape's Fitness Center has floor-to-ceiling windows overlooking the ocean. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen In addition to cardio machines, the Fitness Center is loaded with Technogym equipment as well as free weights. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Norwegian Escape's Mandara Spa is located in a prime location at the front of the ship on Deck 16. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Mandara Spa on the Norwegian Escape has 24 treatment rooms including two for couples. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Mandara Spa on the Norwegian Escape is home to one of the largest thermal suites at sea. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Overlooking the front of the ship, the Norwegian Escape's thermal suite has 33 heated lounge chairs, a sauna, salt room, steam room and a thalassotherapy pool. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Mandara Spa's thermal suite also features one of the first 'snow rooms' at sea, an icy space chilled to 14 degrees fahrenheit. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Mandara Spa is home to a hair and beauty salon. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Norwegian Escape's Shore Excursions desk is located on Deck 6 just off the atrium. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Ping Pong is among the amusements available on the top decks of Norwegian Escape. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Passengers will find touch-screen electronic sign boards across the Norwegian Escape to direct them to entertainment, dining and other activities. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The 164,600-ton Norwegian Escape is Norwegian Cruise Line's largest ship ever. ©2015 Michel Verdure - www.verd Fullscreen Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay Autoplay Show Thumbnails Show Captions Last Slide Next Slide The 164,600-ton Norwegian Escape is Norwegian Cruise Line's largest ship ever. (Photo: ©2015 Michel Verdure - www.verd)
121 CONNECT 3 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE ABOARD THE NORWEGIAN ESCAPE -- The last executive to run Norwegian Cruise Line, Kevin Sheehan, often talked about pushing the brand from good to great. But it takes just a few minutes with the new boss, Frank Del Rio, to get the sense that the goal post has been moved even further. Perfection just might be the new mantra.
"I insist on spotless ships," Del Rio says as one example when asked about things he's changing at Norwegian since taking over nine months ago. "So there's a whole newfound appreciation for clean ships at Norwegian."
Cuisine also is an area when Del Rio is setting a higher bar. He hints that he wasn't entirely happy with what he found in the food department upon arrival.
"I've never met anyone who said, 'no, I like my food bad.' Everybody loves good food," he quips during an exclusive interview aboard Norwegian's new ship, the Norwegian Escape . "We're going to bring good food on board. Whether it's Asian or Italian or steakhouses, it's going to be the best it possibly can be."
USA TODAY
First look: Inside Norwegian Cruise Line's giant new ship
From Del Rio, that's no idle boast. As the founder of upscale line Oceania Cruises, he's responsible for one of the Cruise World's best-known brands for foodies, and in recent years he added a second line known for gourmet eats to his portfolio, luxury operator Regent Seven Seas Cruises. Mainstream brand Norwegian became the third and by far the biggest line under his control in January when he became CEO of the holding company that controls all three cruise operators.
Already, the food on board Norwegian ships is changing. Several of the signature Norwegian restaurants on the Escape feature revamped menus, and there are several new outlets that take cuisine to a higher level than what typically has been found at the line.
"I guarantee to you that prior to us having arrived at Norwegian you wouldn't have had the lunch that you had on the ship (today)," Del Rio declares, referring to an eatery called Food Republic where earlier in the day he had spotted this reporter sampling an array of elegant and inspired tapas-like dishes. The a la carte outlet was created in partnership with the Pubbelly Boys, the culinary team that has reinvented the dining scene in Miami's South Beach in recent years.
A new eatery called Food Republic on Norwegian Cruise Line's Norwegian Escape serves a mix of tapas-like small dishes. (Photo: Gene Sloan, USA TODAY)
"That came from the heritage that (Oceania and Regent) bring to the table in terms of food," Del Rio says.
The longtime cruise industry executive is chatting in a lounge in The Haven, Escape's exclusive retreat for passengers in top suites. It's another area where he's making changes.
A signature of Norwegian ships, The Haven boasts its own pool, sun deck, restaurant and bar, and it comes with personal butler and concierge service. But Del Rio suggests it wasn't quite living up to its billing as the ultimate in luxury at sea.
"If you're going to play in the luxury game, you don't cut corners. You give it all you got," he says. "We're going to elevate The Haven. The bones are here to have a heck of a product, and we're going to fill it in with the level of service, the cuisine at the restaurant and the attention to detail."
Del Rio is known among cruise industry executives for an almost obsessive focus on even the littlest things when building new ships. He and another executive, Bob Binder, personally picked out much of the art hanging in Oceania's newest vessels.
Like other recent Norwegian ships, Norwegian Escape boasts an exclusive, multi-deck retreat for passengers in top suites called The Haven. (Photo: Gene Sloan, USA TODAY)
Escape already was well along in construction when Del Rio took the helm at Norwegian, and many key decisions on the design already had been made. Even so, he says he was able to make some tweaks to the ship's decor that he thinks improved the look.
"We didn't change any steel," he notes, referring to the sort of big changes in design that require already-underway public spaces to be reconfigured. "It was too late. (But) the next vessels will have my finger prints all over them."
Norwegian currently has three more ships on order, all of the same class as Escape.
Still, it's not just Norwegian's new ships that are getting Del Rio's attention. He says he's pouring money into the line's 10 oldest vessels over the next two years to upgrade them to a level he says will be even better than when they debuted. Already, the line's five-year-old Norwegian Epic has emerged from a massive makeover as has the eight-year-old Norwegian Gem.
"We spent a lot of money on them, and Epic today is better than she was the day she left (the shipyard) five years ago," he says.
The upgrades should result in higher demand for the vessels, which in turn will boost pricing and return on investment.
It's a "spend money to make money" strategy Del Rio has used at Oceania and Regent over the years -- one that is in contrast to the always-be-cutting-costs mantra at some lines. Big overhauls of older ships at Oceania and Regent have boosted demand and allowed for higher pricing.
"As long as you maintain your vessels to the highest possible standards (and) continually update them, there is no reason an older vessel can't be as popular in the marketplace as a new one," Del Rio says.
Regent's oldest and smallest ship, the Seven Seas Navigator, is the line's most profitable, he notes.
Over 2016 and 2017, all but one of Norwegian's 10 oldest vessels will undergo a major overhaul in dry dock, Del Rio says. He throws around numbers like $50 million in upgrades per ship, which is several times the amount that some of Norwegian's competitors spend on overhauls.
"This is a capital intensive business. If you're going to stay in it for the long run, you have to be willing to commit capital, and not just to build new ships," he says. "I don't know why others don't do it."
The bottom line, says Del Rio: "In two short years, this fleet will be brand new."
. . . . . . . . .
USA TODAY Cruise this week is getting exclusive access among U.S. media outlets to Norwegian Escape. For our 'first look' tour of the ship, click through the carousel at the top of this story. Click through the carousel below for a first look at Escape's swankiest suites and standard cabins.
Norwegian Cruise Line's newest ship, Norwegian Escape, features some of the most elegant suites at sea, including its four 900-square-feet The Haven Deluxe Owner's Suites. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Norwegian Escape's The Haven Deluxe Owner's Suites are part of a private area of the ship called The Haven that has its own pool, sun deck and restaurant. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Haven Deluxe Owner's Suite have a separate living room with dining area. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The master bedroom in Haven Deluxe Owner's Suites features large glass windows overlooking the ocean. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Passengers in The Haven Deluxe Owner's Suites receive complimentary butler and concierge service. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The master bathroom of a The Haven Deluxe Owner's Suite has a vanity with two sinks, a bathtub and walk-in shower. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The master bath in The Haven Deluxe Owner's Suites has a tub with views of the ocean. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The master bedrooms of The Haven Deluxe Owner's Suites feature large walk-in closets. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Located at the top of the ship, The Haven Deluxe Owner's Suites have large balconies. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Haven Deluxe Owner's Suites have a second bedroom with a double sofa bed. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The second bedroom in The Haven Deluxe Owner's Suites has its own bathroom. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Haven Deluxe Owner's Suites also have a half bath off the living room for visitors. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Smaller than Haven Deluxe Owner's Suites but still grand are the Norwegian Escape's four Haven Owner's Suite. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Part of the exclusive Haven complex, Haven Owner's Suites on the Norwegian Escape measure 475 square feet. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Like other suites in The Haven complex, Haven Owner's Suites come with complimentary Nespresso coffee makers. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Haven Owner's Suites have separate bedrooms with king size beds. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The bedrooms in Haven Owner's Suites open onto a large balcony that also is accessible from the living area. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Haven Owner's Suites face the front of the ship and feature large balconies. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Haven Owner's Suites feature large walk-in closets with extensive room for hanging clothes. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Haven Owner's Suites feature double sinks, bathtubs and separate showers. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Haven Owner's Suite bathrooms feature separate toilet areas. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The showers in Haven Owner's Suites are larger than most on the Norwegian Escape. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The living area of Haven Owner's Suites boast plush sofas, a coffee table, chair and desk area. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Among the more upscale accommodations on the Norwegian Escape are its 14 The Haven Spa Suites, which are part of the ship's exclusive Haven complex. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Haven Spa Suites measure 280 square feet (not including the balcony) and come with complimentary access to the Norwegian Escape's thermal spa area. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Among spa-like touches in The Haven Spa Suites is a personal hot tub-like bath built into the bedroom. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Haven Spa Suites feature a large built-in armoire near the entrance among other storage. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Armoires in The Haven Spa Suites have room for hanging clothes and come with an umbrella for passenger use. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Spa Suite bathrooms have a sleek, contemporary design. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Spa suite bathrooms are large with double-faucet sinks and walk-in showers. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Like other suites in The Haven complex, Haven Spa Suites feature upscale Bvlgari toiletries in bathrooms. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Haven Spa Suites have built-in miniature refrigerators, a feature found in most cabin categories. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Among other large suites on the Norwegian Escape are its 26 The Haven Penthouses, which measure 390 square feet not including the balcony. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Haven Penthouses have a separate living area with sofa and dining nook. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Haven Penthouses have bedrooms with king size beds. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Haven Penthouse bedrooms have built-in storage areas on several walls. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Storage areas in Haven Penthouse bedrooms aer built with flat fronts and are almost unnoticeable when closed. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen When open, built-in storage areas in Haven Penthouses reveal lots of room for hanging clothes and shelving. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Haven Penthouses features large bathrooms with double sinks, tubs and separate showers. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Haven Penthouse bathrooms have tubs with a view of the ocean. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Haven Penthouse showers also have windows overlooking the ocean. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Haven Penthouse bathrooms boast a small built-in grooming station. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Haven Penthouses have large balconies that are at least 30 square feet in size. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Like other recent Norwegian ships, Norwegian Escape boasts an exclusive, multi-deck retreat for passengers in top suites called The Haven. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Haven's private, magrodome-covered pool area features lounge chairs in and out of the water. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Haven's magrodome-covered pool area also has two hot tubs. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Three decks high, The Haven on Norwegian Escape features two indoor lounge areas. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Haven Lounge on Deck 17 has its own bar accessible only to passengers staying in a Haven suite. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Also larger than standard cabins on the Norwegian Escape are its 20 Spa Mini Suites, which measure 205 square feet not including the balcony. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Spa Mini Suites come with access to the thermal suite in the Norwegian Escape's Mandara Spa. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Spa Mini Suites have a desk area with a built-in miniature refrigerator. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Amenities in Spa Mini Suites include a coffee maker. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The desk area of Spa Mini Suites has three U.S.-style electric outlets and a single European-style outlet. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Spa Mini Suites have built-in armoires with room for hanging clothes, several shelves and a personal safe. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Spa Mini Suites feature balconies measuring 30 square feet. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Spa Mini Suites have larger bathrooms than the typical standard cabin on the Norwegian Escape. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Spa Mini Suite bathrooms have a wide sink with two faucets, toilet and shower but no tub. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen As with The Haven suites, Spa Mini Suite bathrooms are stocked with upscale Bvlgari toiletries. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen There are 308 Mini Suites in all on the Norwegian Escape, including Mini Suites specially designed for passengers with disabilities. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Mini Suites are spread across eight of Norwegian Escape's decks. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen This accessible Mini Suite on Deck10 (room 10918) has a built-in desk area and storage along one wall. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The bathroom of an accessible Mini Suite. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Located at the aft of the Norwegian Escape, this accessible Mini Suite features an unusually large balcony area. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The most common type of cabin on the Norwegian Escape is the standard Balcony cabin. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen There are 1,168 Balcony cabins on the Norwegian Escape spread over many decks. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Balcony cabins measure 172 square feet. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Balcony cabins feature built-in desk areas. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Balcony cabins also have sofas. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The sofas of Balcony cabins feature storage along their bottoms. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Balcony cabins have large built-in armoires with room for hanging clothes and shelving. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The built-in armoires in Balcony cabins also have personal safes. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Balcony cabin bathrooms have a sink with a single faucet, toilet and shower. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The shower of a Balcony cabin. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Like Norwegian's last three vessels, the Norwegian Escape features a cluster of small Studio cabins for solo travelers. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Measuring just 100 square feet, Studio cabins have a highly efficient layout that fits a full-size bed, storage areas, shower, sink and toilet. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The shower in Studio cabins stands alone in one corner of the room. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Toilets in Studio cabins are in their own compartment. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Sliding doors along one wall of Studio rooms open to reveal hidden storage. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Norwegian Escape has 407 windowless "inside" cabins, many of which have pull-down bunks to create sleeping spots for four people. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Interior cabins on the Norwegian Escape measure from 130 to 150 square feet. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Interior cabins have a single narrow built-in storage unit. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The built-in storage unit in interior cabins has room for hanging clothes. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen An Interior cabin bathroom. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The shower in an interior cabin bathroom. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Norwegian Escape also has Oceanview cabins (cabins with windows but no balconies). Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Most Oceanview cabins on Norwegian Escape measure 160 square feet. Forty-eight larger "family" Oceanview cabins offer 220 square feet. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Oceanview cabins have two beds that can be pushed together to create one larger bed. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen An Oceanview cabin bathroom. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen An Oceanview cabin shower. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Identical in size to the Norwegian Escape's Balcony cabins are 16 Spa Balcony cabins that come with access to the thermal suite in the ship's Mandara Spa. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen There are just 16 Spa Balcony cabins on the Norwegian Escape, a tiny fraction of the ship's 1,168 balcony cabins. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Like standard Balcony cabins, Spa Balcony cabins have a large armoire for storage. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The built-in armoires in Spa Balcony cabins have room for hanging clothes, shelving and a personal safe. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Spa Balcony cabins have 30-square-foot balconies. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Hair dryers are tucked under the desk area in many of the standard cabins on the Norwegian Escape. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen While the bathrooms in top suites have upscale Bvlgari shampoo, soap and other toiletries, most cabins feature a more basic liquid cleanser. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Like this topic?
